title: Provide downloadable ZIP of full project source code (frontend + backend)

requirements.text: Add a repository-level packaging/export workflow that produces a single ZIP archive containing the full project source code (frontend + backend), suitable for the user to download and run locally.
acceptanceCriteria: A single ZIP archive (e.g., project-source.zip) can be generated that includes backend/ and frontend/ source files needed to build and deploy the app.
The ZIP archive excludes large/generated folders (e.g., node_modules/, .dfx/, dist/build artifacts) to keep the download small and source-focused.
The ZIP archive preserves required config files and manifests needed to run locally (e.g., dfx.json/package manifests if present) without manual reconstruction.
Running the packaging command/script twice produces a valid ZIP without errors and overwrites/updates the previous ZIP deterministically.

requirements.text: Add clear, English documentation describing how to obtain and use the exported ZIP (how to unzip, install dependencies, run locally, and deploy to the Internet Computer).
acceptanceCriteria: Documentation exists in a top-level README section or a dedicated markdown file and is written in English.
Docs include the exact steps to: unzip the project, install frontend dependencies, start the frontend, and deploy the Motoko canister with dfx.
Docs mention any prerequisites (e.g., Node.js/npm, DFX) and where the backend and frontend live in the folder structure.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
Do not edit frontend files under the immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose instead).
Do not add external databases or third-party auth providers; Internet Identity only.
nonGoals: Adding new website features or changing existing UI/branding beyond what is required to support exporting/downloading the code.
Implementing an in-app code editor or serving source code ZIPs from the Motoko canister.
